text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) said it did not expect interbank money rates to hold at current levels -- 24-26 percent -- but that it was hard to predict whether they would rise further or fall to levels before the end of last year.

- The customs administration said it expected the full year 1996 trade deficit to significantly exceed the forecasted shortfall of 50-52 bilion crowns. The final trade balance is expected to be released this week.
- Overall investment into the restructuring of the economy is estimated to total some 220 billion crowns by the year 2000. Some 60 percent should be covered by industrial resources.
- French-Slovak GSM operator Globtel said it had 1,230 customers in the first two weeks of operation.

NARODNA OBRODA - The government will discuss the economic impacts of creating free trade zones, mainly the planned free trade agreement with Russia at its session on Tuesday. The preliminary agenda does not include any other major economic items.
- The ministry of health care said it would raise wages of doctors by 35 percent from April 1.
- Michal Kovac Junior, son of President Michal Kovac, said he had recieved an anonymous death threat.
SME - Opposition deputy and former foreign minister Eduard Kukan said Slovakia's military neutrality would be much more expensive than NATO membership.
- Imports of Czech beer are expected to increase to roughly 800,000 hectolitres this year, from last year's 650,000.
PRAVDA - The opposition Christian Democratic Movement (KDH) said it expected to collect the required 350,000 signatures for a petition to initiate direct presidential election, in February.
